data.meanings: to wonder, menstruate, rejoice, inspire with awe, ridicule, laugh at, laugh, become clear.
data.sentence: The word ضَاحِكَةٌ comes from the root ض ح ك and is associated with the meanings: to wonder, menstruate, rejoice, inspire with awe, ridicule, laugh at, laugh, become clear.

data.meanings: Skin/Pare/Strip/Skin Contact/Epidermis (or insides)Complexion/Hue->Delicacy, fineness ofBeauty/Elegance of form/Bright cheerful countenanceRejoiced/Rejoicing/Good, good tidings, glad tidings/Announcements (bearer of), proclaiming, commencement, beginnings of anything/Indications/Streaks (daylight breaking, wind over land)Conducting, managing affairs personally.Lie with, to go in unto.Mankind, Human beings, Lowest/basest/meanest sort of people, Perfect man (combining gentleness with strength).
data.sentence: The word مُسْتَبْشِرَةٌ comes from the root ب ش ر and is associated with the meanings: Skin/Pare/Strip/Skin Contact/Epidermis (or insides)Complexion/Hue->Delicacy, fineness ofBeauty/Elegance of form/Bright cheerful countenanceRejoiced/Rejoicing/Good, good tidings, glad tidings/Announcements (bearer of), proclaiming, commencement, beginnings of anything/Indications/Streaks (daylight breaking, wind over land)Conducting, managing affairs personally.Lie with, to go in unto.Mankind, Human beings, Lowest/basest/meanest sort of people, Perfect man (combining gentleness with strength).
